Key Match Events: Yoshinobu Yamamoto pitched a six-inning scoreless start, retiring 10 straight batters after allowing a solo homer.
Juan Soto hit a solo home run in the fourth inning, tying the game at 1-1.
Giancarlo Stanton hit an RBI single in the ninth inning, loading the bases for the Yankees.
Jazz Chisholm Jr. and Anthony Rizzo both had hits, loading the bases for the Yankees in the ninth inning.
Blake Treinen struck out Anthony Volpe on nine pitches, preserving the Dodgers' 4-2 lead.
Pre-Game Insights: Aaron Judge is 1-for-9 with six strikeouts in the World Series so far.

The Dodgers took a 4-1 lead into the ninth inning but loaded the bases with one out, setting up a potential comeback.
Max Scherzer pitched a perfect game with 20 strikeouts in the 2024 World Series, though it was not in this game.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win.
The coach highlighted the victory as a pivotal moment in their playoff push.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Yoshinobu Yamamoto's performance included retiring 11 batters in a row after allowing a solo homer.
